questions.question: Which of these numbers is closest to 8/10?

Five friends — Ava, Ben, Clara, Diego, Ella — live along a straight path in that order.
Ava lives 600 m from Clara and 900 m from Ella.
Ben is twice as far from Ava as she is from Clara.
Ben and Diego are the same distance from Clara.
How far does Diego live from Ella?

A shape is made using identical grey rectangles and one white square in the middle.

Each rectangle has an area of 48 cm² and is 4 cm wide.
What is the area of the white square?

The numbers 5 and 30 have a highest common factor of 5 and lowest common multiple of 30. Another pair of numbers also share HCF 5 and LCM 30.
What is the sum of this second pair?

Buses travel between Valeville and Hilltown:

Jamie takes the second bus from Hilltown to Valeville, and returns on the very next bus to Hilltown. How long was Jamie away from Hilltown?

A piece of paper is folded twice in the following manner:

A small triangle is cut out at the centre of the folded paper.
What shape will appear when the paper is completely unfolded?

Mia is placing chairs in rows. Each row must have the same number of chairs. She has 99 chairs but wants to arrange them into exactly 7 full rows.
How many more chairs does she need?

Zara creates a number sequence by following these steps:
  • Multiply by 3 to get the next number.
  • Subtract 5 from the previous number to get the next number.
  • Repeat the steps.
If she starts with the number 3, what is the 5th number in the sequence?

A tin of juice is weighed as shown below:

After pouring out some juice, it is weighed again.

What is the weight of the tin when all the juice is poured out?
A bag contains red and blue marbles in a ratio of 2:5. There are 18 more blue marbles than red ones. How many marbles are there in total?

Sonia says a number is "bouncy" if it leaves the same remainder when divided by 4 as when it is divided by 6.
Which of these numbers would Sonia call bouncy?
9 13 21

Ethan, Bella, and Chloe share a pie. Ethan eats ¼, Bella eats ½, and Chloe eats the rest.
Which statements are true?
1. Ethan eats less than Bella.
2. The entire pie is eaten.
3. Chloe eats ¼ of the pie.

Two boxes are placed on different weighing machines.

What is the difference in weight between the two boxes?
A toy workshop makes 4 teddy bears every 6 hours. If it runs non-stop from Monday to Sunday, how many teddy bears will it produce in a week?

Two friends, Asha and Niko, had a combined age of 30 years four years ago.
What will their total age be in six years from now?

A large triangle-shaped figure is made from 16 equilateral small triangles, some of which are shaded.

Liam wants to shade one more triangle so that the given dotted line through the center becomes a line of symmetry.
Which triangle should he shade?

Here is a number pattern:

The first number is 2. After that, add ⅓ to get the next number.
What is the 25th number in the pattern?

A drawer contains 3 same pairs of blue mittens and 2 same pairs of green mittens.
Each pair has a left and a right mitten.
They’re all mixed in the drawer.
What is the minimum number of mittens Anna must pick blindly to guarantee she gets a matching left and right mitten of the same colour?

Tina builds a prism using small cubes.

Here are three other prisms built using same small cubes:

Which prism has the same volume as Tina’s?
How many numbers from 1 to 99 have exactly one digit that is a 3?

A booklet is made from 6 large sheets folded together.
Pages are numbered from 1 to 24. Which pages are printed on the same sheet as page 4?

The paper given below has been painted with some red and blue squares and then folded along the dotted line.

When the paper is unfolded, any red square touching a blue square makes both turn purple.
After unfolding, how many purple squares will there be?

A garden is paved using square bricks with side length 50 cm.
The total area paved is square metres. How many bricks were used?
A workshop lasted 4 hours 40 minutes and ended at quarter to 5. What time did the workshop begin?

Sam has eight equilateral cardboard triangles.

He wants to make new shapes using at least two triangles, joined by full sides, with no gaps or overlaps, like this:

Which other shapes can Sam make?

Leo’s toy robot is 23 cm tall. His action figure is twice as tall as the robot.
His plush bear is 35 cm taller than the action figure.
His miniature car is 60 mm long. How much taller is the plush bear than the miniature car?

Julie practices jump rope daily for 6 days. The bar chart shows the time she took (in minutes) each day.

Statements:
1. Julie improved her time every day.
2. The total time on Days 2 and 5 is the same as Days 3 and 4.
3. Her best time was on Day 6.
Which statement(s) is/are correct?

At a market, these are the prices:
  • apples for 20c
  • bananas for 15c
  • oranges for 10c
Jamie pays with a dollar and gets back three coins, all different. Which fruits could he have bought?

It’s currently 4:15

What angle will be formed clockwise from the minute hand to the hour hand after 5 minutes?
What is the total length of all the lines in this square grid?

In the first diagram, the values of the symbols are multiplied:

In the second, the same rule is followed:

What is the missing value in this diagram?
Which of the following 3D shapes has at least 5 faces, 8 edges, and 5 vertices?

Anna looks at a hiking trail on her map.
She thinks the path goes north (N), then north-east (NE), then west (W).
She realizes that she has held the map upside-down.
What directions does the trail actually go?

Arun wrote the number 42 and reversed the digits to form 24, which is 18 less than the original. Now, Meera writes a number between 10 and 99, and finds that reversing the digits makes it 72 more than what she wrote.
What was the first digit of Meera’s original number?

This shape is made of five connected squares: A, B, C, D, E.

Square A has side length of 5 cm and square D has side length of 3 cm.
What is the side length of square A?
